headline.main: A Self-Described Slacker Decides He's Ready to Be a Soldier

lead_paragraph: On Oct. 4, Kirk Evans had his grandmother drive him to the Army recruiting station, a storefront wedged between a tanning salon and a window-blind shop in a strip mall a few miles from his home in Bloomington, Ill. It was one day after his 19th birthday and three days before the United States began bombing Afghanistan. Mr. Evans did not see himself as obvious soldier material.
abstract: Article in series Enlisted Man profiles Kirk Evans, 19-year-old from Bloomington, Ill; self-described slacker, Evans enlists in army after watching news of Sept 11 terror attacks; photos (M)
